Sonié Joi Thompson-Ruffin (amụrụ n'afọ 1951 na Joplin, Missouri) bụ ónyé America na-ese ihe, onye edemede, onye na-ese onyinyo, ónyé nhazi Ọbọdọ, na onye nlekọta. Ruffin na-emepụta akwa site na iji akwa, ihe nnọchianya, na ntinye aka na akwa akwa Africa nke na-enyocha okwu ndị metụtara ikike mmadụ, agbụrụ, na okike

E gosipụtara ọrụ ya na United States, Africa, na Europe, na Renwick Gallery nke Smithsonian American Art Museum, White House Rotunda, na Nelson-Atkins Museum of Art. Ọ bụ ónyé na-ese ihe na Charlotte Street Foundation na onye na-elekọta ụlọ na American Jazz Museum. Thompson-Ruffin bụ otu n'ime ndị guzobere African American Artists Collective, otu ndị na-ese ihe n'Afrịka na Kansas City. A họpụtara Thompson-Ruffin ka o mepụta mkpuchi ncheta Nelson Mandela site na South African Consulate na Grace and Holy Trinity Cathedral. A na-edebe ọrụ ya na nchịkọta dịka Spencer Museum of Art na Lawrence, Kansas, na ndị ọzọ
E gosipụtara ọrụ ya n'ihu akwụkwọ akụkọ New Letters na nke KC Studio Magazine.
